html:ul.html:li: 190 Economies around the world are ranked by the World Bank on ten parameters wherein, ‘Getting Electricity’ is also one of the parameters.

Some of the parameters considered in evaluating ‘Getting Electricity’ for an electricity connection which impact a 140KW / 150 KVA connection on 415V supply are as follows:
Time taken to get electricity connection.
Cost required for getting a new connection.
Procedure required to be completed for getting new connection.
Reliability of Electricity supply.

The concerted efforts of Ministry of Power, Central Electricity Authority, Government of Maharashtra and the DISCOMS in Delhi and Mumbai, have contributed in raising India’s rank in ‘Getting Electricity’ from 137th rank in 2015 to 26th rank in 2017 (Fig(i)).
Many reforms have been undertaken to improve the rankings
Installation of transformers on Pole Mounted Substations up to 500KVA, earlier the provision is only for 250 KVA transformers.
Electrical Inspection Clearance Authority given to DISCOM for installations up to 11 KV.
Energization within 15 days for new electricity connections requests received through online mode.
Number of documents required for obtaining a new electricity connections reduced to 2 nos. along with application form.

Online facility provided to the consumer for
Registration of New Electricity Connections.
Uploading of Documents.
Payments of Estimate Charges.
Procedure for obtaining a New Connection have been reduced to 3:

Implementation of Outage Management System, and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition system (SCADA) for improved reliability. Tata Power Reliability Indices for FY 17 are as follows:
